intro: Heteropterys microdon, commonly known as the small-leaf velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that are typically followed by spherical, woody fruits. It is native to Central and South America and thrives in humid, tropical environments. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in warm climates for its foliage and floral display.
